result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:33 AM Defendant Caleb R. Mansfield appeared by video, in custody at New Lisbon Correctional.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Caleb R. Mansfield.  District Attorney (DA) Cass Cousins appears on behalf of Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
DA Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Renc withdraws her request for a speedy trial.
Atty Renc would prefer time in February or March 2023.
DA Cousins does not object to the requested dates for a trial.
Trial to be set for 2 days.
Written discovery has been exchanged.
DA Cousins makes a statement as he is covering for ADA Brian Pfeil.

3:11 PM Defendant Caleb R. Mansfield in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Caleb R. Mansfield. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
